description.narrative: The United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC) aims is to combat transnational crime, including corruption, human trafficking and people smuggling, drug-use prevention and treatment, drug trafficking and terrorism. UNODC is a co-chair of the UN System Task Force to combat the threats to security and stability presented by transnational organised crime and drug trafficking and is working through the task force on regional organised crime threat assessments. Funding under this initiative by the Australian Department of Foreign Affairs supports UNODC to enhance coordination and cooperation in the delivery of anti-corruption technical assistance to the Tonga Government in transnational crime threat assessments.
